intro: Clidemia grandifolia, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in the summer months. Clidemia grandifolia is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
